page.title: 15HOUSING IN CREWE
page.content:
In Crewe many of the houses were built in the 1800's and most of them are terraced, made from red brick and have slate roofs. Many of the slate roofs have now been replaced by tiles.
The first houses built in Crewe were originally built by the railway company in the 1840's. These houses are in Tollit Street and Gaffer's row. They were bought and restored by the council in 1979 and then sold. Crewe has many cottage-type houses with two up and two down.
Along Nantwich Road there are large terraced houses and then modern semi-detached and detached houses.
